name: MikeyPdog TLD-Minimods
description: The Long Dark: Mikes Mini Mods

releases.name: Faster Searching
releases.description:
Empty Containers are instant to search.
Non-Empty containers are faster to search.

releases.name: Less Effective Repairs
releases.description: Repairing clothing repairs half as much condition.

releases.name: Sprint Costs Food
releases.description: Sprinting uses 5x as much food as normal
releases.changes: Added customisable settings to main menu

releases.name: Starving Hurts
releases.description: Starving (0 food) causes 5x more damage than normal.
releases.changes: Added customisable settings to main menu

releases.name: Less Calories Needed
releases.description: You use half as many calories as normal.

releases.name: Frostbite Not Permanent
releases.description: Frostbite is no longer permanent. Instead you take -20% condition immediately.

releases.name: Quicker Mapping
releases.description: Mapping with charcoal takes 1 in-game minute rather than 15.

releases.name: BetterXP - Mending
releases.description:
Mending XP is required for crafting clothing:
* Level 1: Rabbitskin items
* Level 2: Deerskin items
* Level 3: Moose hide items
* Level 4: Wolfskin items
* Level 5: Bearskin items.
Give Mending XP for crafting clothing
Sometimes give Mending XP for crafting bandages
releases.changes: Added customisable settings to main menu

releases.name: Tinder Matters
releases.description: Different tinder now affects your chance of lighting a fire.
releases.changes: Added customisable settings to main menu. Bumped birch bark to +5%. Bumped cattails and tinder plug to +0%. Bumped no tinder to -5%.

releases.name: Mouse Mod
releases.description: Disable mouse acceleration and tweak mouse smoothing.

releases.name: Quicker Wood Cutting
releases.description: Chopping limbs and branches takes less time.
releases.changes: Added customisable settings to main menu

releases.name: Archery Target Practice
releases.description: The archery target in pleasant valley can be used to level up archery (only level 1 and 2)

releases.name: ConsumeTorchOnFirestart
releases.description:
Torches are consumed if you attempt to start a fire with them, and now offer +5% higher fire success rate.

Experienced players typically light fires by lighting a torch from a match (100% success rate) and then repeatedly trying to start a fire with the torch, basic tinder, a stick and no accelerant. This makes things like books and accelerant a bit pointless as you can simply retry with the same torch. It wouldnt be so bad if torch crafting was required (using cloth) but you can just pull torches from fires and extinguish them which makes them very easy to acquire.

You can still move fire from one place to the next by lighting a torch, moving to a new location, throwing the torch on the ground, then lighting more torches from it, and starting a fire with those torches. This strategy requires carrying quite a few torches though (which are heavy) and torches get blown out if its windy, so I figure this is still fine.

This works well with my TinderMatters mod.
